# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cancer`
* Variable label: `Any malignancy (C00-D48) / information about past or current neoplasm (benign, in situ, malignant)`
* Variable description: `cancer diagnosis since the last interview`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | no cancer
1        | cancer

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `cancer_age`
* Variable label: `Age of cancer diagnosis`
* Variable description: `Age of each episode of cancer`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "Any malignancy (C00-D48) / information about past or current neoplasm (benign, in situ, malignant)"
ds_label_age <- "Age of cancer diagnosis"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## HRS

### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `R1CANCRE` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `R1CANCRE:W1 R ever had cancer`|
| **Table name**  | `HRS-HRS-w1`|
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign hrs_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_hrs_w1','HRS.HRS-HRS-w1',variables=list('R1CANCRE'), missings = T)
HRS_hrs_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_hrs_w1')

```

```{r local hrs_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w1$R1CANCRE
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(R1CANCRE))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `NA into 999`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w1 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w1$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w1$R1CANCRE, "NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript hrs_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cancer
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(cancer))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation hrs_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$cancer, useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- table(HRS_hrs_w1$R1CANCRE, useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0->0","1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(HRS_hrs_w1)

```



### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `R2CANCRS` |`ybirth`|`yintw (hrs_w1)`|`yintw (hrs_w2)`|
|-|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `R2CANCRS:W2 R had cancer since last IW`|`year of birth`|`year of interview`|`year of interview`|
| **Table name**  | `HRS-HRS-w2`|`ybirth`|`yintw`|`yintw`|
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |`continuous`|`continuous`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `NA`| `999 = Missing` |  |  |
| **Description** |  |  |  |  |

```{r assign hrs_w2, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_hrs_w2','HRS.HRS-HRS-w2',variables=list('R2CANCRS'), missings = T)
HRS_hrs_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_hrs_w2')
load(paste0(datafolder,"hrs_w2/ybirth.RData"))
HRS_hrs_w2 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w2,ybirth, by="id")
rm(ybirth)
load(paste0(datafolder,"hrs_w1/yintw.RData"))
HRS_hrs_w2 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w2,yintw, by="id")
names(HRS_hrs_w2)[4] <- "yintw_hrs_w1"
rm(yintw)
load(paste0(datafolder,"hrs_w2/yintw.RData"))
HRS_hrs_w2 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w2,yintw, by="id")
names(HRS_hrs_w2)[5] <- "yintw_hrs_w2"
rm(yintw)

```

```{r local hrs_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w2$R2CANCRS
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w2)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w2, aes(x=factor(R2CANCRS))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w2)[3])
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w2, aes(ybirth)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(1900,1980)

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w2$yintw_hrs_w1
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w2)[4])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w2, aes(x=factor(yintw_hrs_w1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w2$yintw_hrs_w2
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w2)[5])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w2, aes(x=factor(yintw_hrs_w2))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w2, cancer_age = (year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2+(year of interview w1 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w2}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w2 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w2$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w2$R2CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w2$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w2$yintw_hrs_w2[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w2$yintw_hrs_w1[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript hrs_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w2, aes(x=factor(cancer))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HRS_ds_hrs_w2$cancer_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w2, aes(cancer_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(40,80)

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation hrs_w2, echo=F, results='asis'}

BeforeH <- table(HRS_hrs_w2$R2CANCRS, useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0->0","1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(HRS_hrs_w2)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

* `if cancer == 1 in w3, cancer_age = (year of interview w3-year of interview w2)/2+(year of interview w2 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w3 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w3}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w3 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w3$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w3$R3CANCRS, "NA=999")

HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w3$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w3$yintw_hrs_w3[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w3$yintw_hrs_w2[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w5, cancer_age = (year of interview w5-year of interview w4)/2+(year of interview w4 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w5 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w5}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w5 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w5$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w5$R5CANCRS, "NA=999")


# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w5$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w5$yintw_hrs_w5[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w5$yintw_hrs_w4[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w5$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w5$cancer == 1  & !HRS_hrs_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

**R script:**

```{r harmo ahead_w3}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w3 <- tibble(id=HRS_ahead_w3$id)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w10, cancer_age = (year of interview w10-year of interview w9)/2+(year of interview w9 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w10 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo ahead_w10}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w10 <- tibble(id=HRS_ahead_w10$id)
HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_ahead_w10$R10CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w10$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ahead_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_ahead_w10$yintw_ahead_w10[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ahead_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_ahead_w10$yintw_ahead_w9[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ahead_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_ahead_w10$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ahead_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w10, cancer_age = (year of interview w10-year of interview w9)/2+(year of interview w9 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w10 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo coda_w10}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w10 <- tibble(id=HRS_coda_w10$id)
HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_coda_w10$R10CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w10$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_coda_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_coda_w10$yintw_coda_w10[which(HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_coda_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_coda_w10$yintw_coda_w9[which(HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_coda_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_coda_w10$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_coda_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_coda_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w6, cancer_age = (year of interview w6-year of interview w5)/2+(year of interview w5 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w6 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo wb_w6}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w6 <- tibble(id=HRS_wb_w6$id)
HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_wb_w6$R6CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w6$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_wb_w6$yintw_wb_w6[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_wb_w6$yintw_wb_w5[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_wb_w6$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w10, cancer_age = (year of interview w10-year of interview w9)/2+(year of interview w9 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w10 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo wb_w10}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w10 <- tibble(id=HRS_wb_w10$id)
HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_wb_w10$R10CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w10$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_wb_w10$yintw_wb_w10[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_wb_w10$yintw_wb_w9[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_wb_w10$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$cancer == 1  & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w9, cancer_age = (year of interview w9-year of interview w8)/2+(year of interview w8 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 1 in w9 and other wave, cancer_age as previously`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo ebb_w9}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ebb_w9 <- tibble(id=HRS_ebb_w9$id)
HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_ebb_w9$R9CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ebb_w9$id))
HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ebb_w9$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_ebb_w9$yintw_ebb_w9[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ebb_w9$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_ebb_w9$yintw_ebb_w8[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ebb_w9$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_ebb_w9$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w9$cancer == 1  & !HRS_ebb_w9$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1 in w11, cancer_age = (year of interview w11-year of interview w10)/2+(year of interview w10 -ybirth)`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `cancer == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo mbb_w11}




# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_mbb_w11 <- tibble(id=HRS_mbb_w11$id)
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer <- car::recode(HRS_mbb_w11$R11CANCRS, "NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_mbb_w11$id))
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer_age[which(HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer == 1  & !HRS_mbb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_mbb_w11$yintw_mbb_w11[which(HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer == 1  & !HRS_mbb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_mbb_w11$yintw_mbb_w10[which(HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer == 1  & !HRS_mbb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_mbb_w11$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_mbb_w11$cancer == 1  & !HRS_mbb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

```{r summ}
  t.mbb[3+i] <- frq(lf.hrs[[37+i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
}
t.mbb[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", length(lb.hrs[[6]][[2]]), length(lf.hrs[[38]][[2]]))
names(t.mbb)<-c("val", "label", "w10", "w11")
kable(t.mbb)

dbb <- merge(HRS_m_ds_mbb_w10[,c("id","cancer")], HRS_m_ds_mbb_w11[,c("id","cancer")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w10",".w11"), all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w10", "w11")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```
